posts.name: Naroglu
posts.cooked:
I hope you all are having a great build/competing season,

Should the cylinder part for the magnetic encoder in the gearbox that comes with the tank chassis needs to be magnetic? We opened it freshly, and according to what was said, it should be polarized; but when we held any metal part such as screws etc., it did not attract. Is there a problem?

posts.name: Sam
posts.cooked: What kind of screws were you trying? If they were aluminum they may not have been magnetic.

posts.name: Naroglu
posts.cooked: we didnâ€™t try only screws but keychains, that normal magnet pulls. Basically these pieces we have does not acts like magnets. And do not miss that this is not encoder magnet, but gearbox magnet .

link_counts.title: 1/4 in. OD x 1.0 in. Long Cylinder Magnet - AndyMark, Inc

posts.name: Naroglu
posts.cooked: [SENDING AGAIN] we didnâ€™t try only screws but keychains, that normal magnet pulls. Basically these pieces we have does not acts like magnets. And do not miss that this is not encoder magnet, but gearbox magnet 3.

posts.name: Gus Michel II
posts.cooked: Did you try the sides of the magnet?  This is supposed to be polarized across a diameter, not across the length.

posts.name: Naroglu
posts.cooked: yes, we tried, it does not attracts to anything.
